alert.note: Alert for Salt Lake (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 6:34PM MDT until April 13 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City UT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Utah... Emigration Creek Near Salt Lake City affecting Salt Lake County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is expected to occur beginning this evening. Peak flows are expected to occur between 10 PM MDT this evening and 12 AM MDT tonight, and will gradually recede through the early morning hours Thursday. * WHERE...Emigration Creek Near Salt Lake City. * WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 2.0 cfs, At 2.0 ft (130 CFS), minor flood damage will impact homes and structures along the stream, including areas of the Hogle Zoo. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Currently, flows are 124 cfs in the creek at the mouth of Emigration Canyon and climbing. Flood flows of 130 cfs are expected over the next hour. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 100.0 cfs early Thursday afternoon. - Flood flow is 126.0 cfs. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 125.0 cfs on 05/20/2011. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/slc. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 630 AM MDT.
